alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 10:59AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Maggie Creek Near Carlin affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Maggie Creek...including Carlin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels and flows are expected. * WHERE...Maggie Creek Near Carlin. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Monitoring stage occurs. No flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM PDT Monday the stage was 4.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM PDT.
